page.title: 11SIKH COMMUNITY, TELFORD
page.content: There are about 200 Sikh families living in the Trench area of Telford, most of whom came to this country in the 1960s.The religious and social life of the Sikh community centres on the local Gurdwara or temple.This is a converted school building in Hadley - about 1.5 miles away.It is open at all times for worship and also provides lodging and food for any one in need. The majority of Sikhs go to the temple on Sundays.During a Sangat,or assembly which lasts for about 3 hours people come and go and children move about freely.The Sunday Sangat at Hadley is followed by a communal meal for those who wish to stay.The Sikhs in this area are a close-knit community who retain their own customs and traditions while adapting their way of life to suit the living and working patterns of the area.
